files.description: Command-line entrypoint to run end-to-end hypothesis generation, robustness checks, and data-confrontation pipeline with reproducible configs.
Defines swampland conjecture objects, parameterizations, priors, and consistency-check evaluators used to map theory constraints into model-level bounds.
Implements model-specific cosmology backends (inflationary/noninflationary, reheating, trans-Planckian, late-time dark energy) with observable calculators.
Computes concrete cosmological observables (ns, r, running, non-Gaussianity amplitudes/shapes, reheating signatures, dark-energy evolution) from model trajectories.
Encodes holographic/entropy/quantum-information-inspired constraints and maps them onto cosmological parameters and consistency tests.
Generates prioritized, testable conjecture→observable hypothesis pairs with explicit signatures, falsification/consistency tests, and ranking heuristics.
Runs robustness plans under realistic compactification/flux choices via scenario samplers, sensitivity analyses, and stress tests for hypothesis stability.
Provides the recommended statistical pipeline (likelihoods, priors, Bayesian/posterior + forecast hooks, model comparison) to confront current and forthcoming data.
Handles configuration loading, schema validation, artifact saving (JSON/CSV), and experiment bookkeeping for reproducible runs.
Generates publication-ready plots for hypothesis rankings, constraint projections, posterior summaries, and robustness diagnostics.
Smoke tests that execute the full pipeline on a small synthetic configuration and assert stable, correctly-shaped outputs and determinism.
CI workflow running linting, type checks, and pytest on pushes and pull requests to satisfy the required CI/CD setup.

missionDescription: Systematically map swampland conjectures and holographic constraints onto concrete, model-specific cosmological observables (inflationary/noninflationary dynamics, non-Gaussianity shapes/amplitudes, reheating/Trans-Planckian signals, and late-time dark-energy evolution). Produce prioritized, testable hypothesis pairs (conjecture → observable signature + consistency test) together with a short robustness plan under realistic compactification/flux choices and a recommended statistical pipeline outline for confronting current/forthcoming data.
missionSuccessCriteria: Generate a prioritized list of at least 6 concrete conjecture→observable hypothesis pairs, each with a concise predicted signature (e.g., CMB bispectrum shape, tensor tilt bounds, reheating spectral features, DE equation-of-state evolution) and the minimal model assumptions required.

For at least 3 of those hypotheses, provide a short robustness assessment (2–4 bullet points each) describing how different compactification/flux choices or moduli stabilization scenarios could weaken/strengthen the signature.

Produce a one-page outline of a statistical pipeline for testing these hypotheses against cosmological data, specifying required data sets, nuisance parameters, likelihood choices, and how to implement swampland-motivated priors versus agnostic priors.

Deliver a prioritized next-step roadmap (3–5 concrete tasks) indicating which hypotheses are ready for immediate computational study, which need further theoretical work, and which require new observational products.
